entry.title: The Black Widow of Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: TheMostUniqueName20

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,203Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 15

Summary: When y/n was 11 years old, she was enrolled at Gotham Academy under a false identity, placed by her Red Room handlers as a part of an early infiltration assignment. "Find out more about the Wayne family, get close to them, and take them out." But what happens when you get too close to the supposed enemy? What happens when you form genuine connections? What happens when you feel like a kid again? Forgetting you're supposed to hurt the Waynes, not be one? Well, the Red Room will step in and cut you out and start your training from scratch again, all while leaving those who now have a connection with you wondering where you are, where it went wrong, if you're okay.... Eventually, they accept your disappearance until you've eventually become a faded memory to them. ¬† Until... 8 years later..... ¬† (Use of y/n, sorry for bad summary üòÖ)

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,808Chapters: 2/15Kudos: 27

Summary: You weren‚Äôt looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn‚Äôt looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn‚Äôt ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier‚Äîsomething that almost feels like home.

entry.title: White Rabbit [Jason Todd]
entry.summary:
Author: thelonelywriter__111

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,716Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 7

Summary: She looked up at him with those kind, trusting eyes, the only kind of eyes that had ever looked at Jason Todd without fear nor indifference, and asked, almost shyly, ‚ÄúDo you ever let anyone take care of you, Jason?‚Äù The question was simple, almost naive. But it struck through his armor and right into his heart like a bullet he hadn‚Äôt seen coming his way. Because no one ever asked that. Not Bruce, not the family he‚Äôd clawed his way back to.Not anyone who‚Äôd lived long enough to know what he‚Äôd become. For a heartbeat, Jason was just a man again, tired, cracked wide open, trying not to cry into his calloused and scarred hands while the smell of cocoa and warm cookies filled the room. And in that fragile quiet, he realized he would do anything, anything, to protect the angel that had dared to touch his broken soul.

Summary: There‚Äôs almost something unsettling about how that moves you‚Äîhow Jason‚Äôs character could be cracked open by a single Jane Austen line, buried in the pages of a book he keeps within reach. What‚Äôs so bad about a big man reading a little bit of Jane Austen, anyway? In which your roommate keeps arriving home bloodied and bruised, stubborn and a little cruel.
